website_summaries.verdict: The best budget computer tower with a unique design that maximizes interior access and space.
pros: Large side panel offers easy access to the inside without having to remove the entire case lid
Interior cable management is straightforward thanks to the 20 cable points disbursed throughout the inside
cons: Instructions can be difficult to follow
Case may ship with faulty fans

customer_reviews.title: This case is awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded to this case from an Antec 900 (awesome case for its time) This case is amazing! The cable management was simple, it looks great, feels sturdy, and has a fantastic price point. It feels very solid and looks very slick! It was large enough for my GTX1070 and even fit my massive Hyper 212 Evo cooler.
customer_reviews.author: GrillUSN

customer_reviews.title: I love this case
customer_reviews.text: I love this case. It's sleek and minimalist. I like how the drive bays and power supply is hidden. All of my components fit. There is enough room to apply a thin LED strip at the bottom and still close it. The only negative thing I have to say about it is that the clear panel scratches easily so take good care of it.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie R

customer_reviews.title: Looks great, some engineering and some parts are pretty shabby. WORST. INSTRUCTIONS. EVER.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Very nice looking, lots of features for the price, plenty of room for everything, awesome cable management. Cons: Engineering in some spots is extremely poor. The captive screws are nice, but the hardware they use is extremely low quality. Bad threading on the rear of the case lead to one of the captive screws stripping out. I think the fasteners fit before the paint was applied, but the paint is thick enough it caused issue throughout. Also, the directions are ATROCIOUS. Absolutely god awful abysmal. A step above worthless. At least they included a ton of small hardware and all the stainless stuff fit nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Ekim

customer_reviews.title: It's nice, pretty
customer_reviews.text: It's nice, pretty, and see through. It has fans already with good airflow. And most importantly, it holds all my stuff (Intel - Core i7-7700K 4.2GHz Quad-Core Processor,CRYORIG - H7 49.0 CFM CPU Cooler, ASRock - Z270 Extreme4 ATX LGA1151 Motherboard, G.Skill - Aegis 32GB (2 x 16GB) DDR4-2133 Memory, Western Digital - Blue 250GB 2.5" Solid State Drive, Seagate - BarraCuda Pro 10TB 3.5" 7200RPM Internal Hard Drive, EVGA - GeForce GTX 1080 8GB FTW Gaming ACX 3.0 Video Card, and EVGA - SuperNOVA G2 750W 80+ Gold Certified Fully-Modular ATX Power Supply)
customer_reviews.author: Vince

customer_reviews.title: review
customer_reviews.text: the case is very nice. I built a pc out of it. couple of days later when it is time to clean the glass i noticed a chip on the top right of it. it is a glass so it is very sharp. I don't want to cut myself, So I emailed NZXT I got a response, they ask me to take a picture so I did now I am just waiting for the response again. will come back and edit if I can get a replacement on the glass panel.
customer_reviews.author: Amador

customer_reviews.title: Nice stuff
customer_reviews.text: Great case! My 3rd ever build while being my first build for "show". I looked an pondered several cases for nearly 2 months before I decided on this one. Pros. Great look, solid construction, adapted for modern PC components, great finish, filters, good fans included, easy cable management Cons Metal shavings! Be sure to blow this thing out before installing any components. Thumb screws or over tightened.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Good but not perfect
customer_reviews.text: Case has great aesthetics and lots of room inside but it does have issues. The acrylic window scratches ridiculously easy. I somehow scratched it with an ultra soft microfiber cloth! The black matte parts on the top and interior scuff easily too. Removing the front panel feels like it could break if I pulled it the wrong way. The case is very sturdy, however. I'm not sorry I bought this case but I do wish it was a bit more durable.
customer_reviews.author: S.

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Case With Great Craftsmanship
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful case, fairly simple to build in, my only complaint would be for the front jut-out where cables can come through to be slightly more open so it doesn't feel like the 24 Pin ATX connector is squeezed by the metal. otherwise it has wonderful cable management straps, a really snappy look to it, nicely packaged screws and cables that made this 100x easier to put together overall without having to double and triple check cabling. I would recommend this to anyone in the PC building realm aside from enthusiasts that already know what they want. Good for Beginner, Intermediate, and Knowledgeable builders.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Very inconvenient for more than one 3.5" HDD
customer_reviews.text: The description says that there are 3x 3.5" bays. But in fact, if you you have more than one 3.5" devices, the SATA and power cables become a problem, because HDDs are stacked next to each other, and SATA ports are located just behind the case's wall. If you want to fit three 3.5" devices, you can't connect one in the lowest bay, because of the bent edge. It can be solved with L-shaped cables, but most of them are bent in the opposite direction, while you can't flip your HDD because of the mount holes in the case.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This case looks great. Cable management was a breeze with it
customer_reviews.text: This case looks great. Cable management was a breeze with it. Every connection I needed there is hole built in perfectly right beside the motherboard. Liquid cooling was also extremely easy to install. So much space in this as well. Everything goes in and out with no problems. My only negatives are how tough the thumbscrews can be, and I had to google how to remove the front panel since the directions aren't super clear about it. Another thing is the window seems to scratch extremely easily. Mine already has many small scratches either from just laying it down or wiping dust off. Can't really notice them unless you're up close inspecting it though.
customer_reviews.author: CorncobBob

customer_reviews.title: Poor airflow
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Looks great Cable management Build quality Easy to install everything Cons: Can be pretty cramped if you have a lot of HDD/SSDs Airflow Other: I had a 240mm radiator for a liquid cooler installed and due to poor air flow my system was over heating and shutting down, I had to run with the front panel off. I've gone to a different case and the problem was alleviated. The case looks great but it couldn't seem to handle a build that produces a substantial amount of heat.
customer_reviews.author: CAM3510

customer_reviews.title: #1 Case, Period.
customer_reviews.text: What can I say about this case? It's absolutely beautiful. There are a lot of feature with this case that was well thought out and insightful, from the VR Headset/ Headphone puck, to the USB 3.0 and HDMI inputs on the front I/O, to the cable managements clips, to the power supply shroud, and lastly to the beautiful tempered glass side panel. I would absolutely recommend this case to anyone building any kind of build. Also, if purchasing the White version and wanting good RGB, I would also purchase the NZXT Hue+ with the case, its a wonderful addition to my case and makes it really become a unique piece on your desk.
customer_reviews.author: Dusten Grant

customer_reviews.title: One of the best cases.
customer_reviews.text: Truly one of the prettiest cases you can get. I actually prefer this version over the elite with the larger glass panel. Sort of an everything you need and nothing you don't to case production. Sure it only comes with two fans but this is really a case meant for you to add in your own features with. This case also just looks so nice in a room. Because of the minimalist design it distances itself from the gaudy "gamer" computer cases that many people are used to. Really love it. Cable management was easier than in other cases I've worked with. However, I will admit that I am not as experienced with cable management. It seems good to me.
customer_reviews.author: Everett Garnett

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful case! I love how they set it up ...
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful case! I love how they set it up for nice cable management. The clips in the bath aren't very strong, but they still work. Air flow is good, but I did buy two more fans just to be sure. This fits my RX580 and big Noctua cooling fan (I forget the model, but it's the largest one). I would buy this again and plan to do future builds with this unless computer towers in the future have some big advantage to this.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle K.

customer_reviews.title: Great case, possible bad port.
customer_reviews.text: I love this case, its strange (for me) having so much space for cord management and having the power supply on the bottom, but it leads to a much cleaner look. Unfortunately, through either a wire I missed plugging or small flaw, one of my two top/front USB ports does not work. It's a minor nuisance due to where the other ports are located, but a USB port splitter in the working port will resolve the issue for me. When opening the box, EVERYTHING is inside the tower, hidden underneath where your power supply will go.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really nice, with a minor issue.
customer_reviews.text: I think this is an excellent case, for the price. You're not paying top dollar, but in many regards, you are getting it. There's ample options for cable management, and the whole thing looks clean and well built. The only minor issue I have with it is the screws. While I love cases with thumbscrews, so you don't need a screwdriver to access it, the threads of the holes are not especially well machined, and the screws don't fit all that well, meaning you often do need a screwdriver to get enough torque to drive them.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Great case. Using it with a ATX motherboard
customer_reviews.text: Great case. Using it with a ATX motherboard, the Kraken 62 cooler mounted in the front with fans pulling in to the radiator. This case is a mini-ATX so it doesn't fit 2 sets of fans on the radiator, nor can you place the radiator on the top or back. Cable management is quite good and hidden in the back side panel which is not glass. Front glass is nice and easy to remove and re-install. Back panel is a bit harder once the cables are in. Great case for showing off RGB.
customer_reviews.author: R. Kwong

customer_reviews.title: Simply Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful case and has amazing cable management. Tons of cords behind the back panel but you can’t see any of them. Super clean. You can spend hours fine tuning your management to be perfect. Also looks gorgeous and is almost 100% metal minus the see through side. Super durable. Awesome fans keeps very cool. Plenty of room for water cooling. Fits my Nvidia 1080 no problem and then some if I wanted to crossfire/sli. Get this case if you’re thinking about it
customer_reviews.author: Thomas L. Porter III

customer_reviews.title: Great cable management options
customer_reviews.text: Great cable management options, nice design. The front panel does not sit flush to the sides, though, which makes the overall impression not as clean as it should be. The front panel also blocks airflow to a good extent, which is significant as the case does not feature a lot of fan mounting options. Additionally, the front USB/etc cables tend to prevent a 140mm fan from being installed; only a 120mm fan fit for me. If you like the design and are only doing mild overclocks, this is a good case. For high overclocks or strong temperature control, look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Washington Irving

customer_reviews.title: Hands down, best mid tower money can buy.
customer_reviews.text: This case is absolutely beautiful. i recently downsized from a full tower to this mid and i was concerned that it may not be enough space. boy was i wrong. The cable management alone makes this the best case i have ever had the pleasure of building a rig from. The SSD mounts are super smart and showy and add that little bit of extra flair. Absolutely love this case, i would have paid more for this, i feel like it was a steal at 99$.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Sleek, modern, good quality, good inputs, and recommended!
customer_reviews.text: SO SLEEK AND MODERN and I love this computer case! I am obsessed with "clean lines" and organization and order. This case is perfect for displaying the beauty of my computer components as well as maintaining a clean front face (mine is in white). With plenty of inputs, including HDMI, this case meets and exceeds all of my needs. I am very impressed with the quality and style of this case. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: PJTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: This case was a joy to work with
customer_reviews.text: This case was a joy to work with, the wire management is by far the best thing about the case (and of course the full glass panel). I was able to install a push pull setup in the rear as exhaust (Corsair H60). I was able to use the extra space at the front for a fun setup, placing something like a figure or a Funko POP and building a theme around this would be a lot of fun (iif you have RGB lights).
customer_reviews.author: THE STAPLEYS

customer_reviews.title: The case is beautiful and relatively easy to work with however so I ...
customer_reviews.text: I would give it a five but mine had some issues. The glass panel was knicked, scratched, and scuffed on arrival. It was doubled boxed however the second box was too big and had no cushioning to prevent it from bouncing around. The last problem was all the thumb screws, all of them, were so tight I could barely remove them with a screw driver. They are thumb screws. I understand for shipment they should be a bit tight but over toghtening and nearly stripping them is uncalled for. The case is beautiful and relatively easy to work with however so I would recommend it to new builders.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Great case other than a couple flaws
customer_reviews.text: Great case other than a couple flaws. 1. The matte black scratches VERY easily. 2. The front panel on my had noticeable vibration noise. It would stop if I lightly pressed on it. I don't have any mechanical drives in my pc either so it was definitely a defect 3. Thumb screws are really hard to screw sometimes. Other than that, beautiful case and design. The glass is stunning.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Burk

customer_reviews.title: Used this on a new Skylake build which turned out ...
customer_reviews.text: Used this on a new Skylake build which turned out well. Major complaint would be the quality of threading of some screw holes and/or screws stripping holes during manufacture assembly. I chose this over the Corsair C400 due to the internal vertical cable cover which just about hides all cables from sight. Unlike the large plastic grommets in the C400. My build: Skylake 6600K / x61Kraken Cooler Asus Sabertooth Z170 S / 16GB GeiL RAM EVGA GTX 1070 SC EVGA 750 Gold PSU
customer_reviews.author: gdel

customer_reviews.title: Overall, a very good case.  Nice solid feel.
customer_reviews.text: Great case. Enough room for all your components and equipped with NZXT fans, this thing is as quiet as a church mouse. Nice side window so you can see all the going ons inside. Only complain is I wish manufactures would actually tool the threads into the expansion slot nuts. All the expansion slot and access panel screws are very tight and do not seat squarely. That's because the screws are used to tap the holes like self tapping screws.
customer_reviews.author: Geeman

customer_reviews.title: Priced right and built well.  Nice looking case.
customer_reviews.text: This was for my son for his gaming computer. I likes it a lot. Like the fact that you can see all the LEDs that came with all the different components he assembled his computer with. With regards to quality. Can't complain. All the default placement of screws and components we right on. No angling of screws to get the board or components to fit. It was made well with lots of room for addition peripherals.
customer_reviews.author: R.M.

customer_reviews.title: Includes a BLACK PUCK, if you want a white one you'll have to order separately.
customer_reviews.text: The best case I've ever owned. For 100 dollars, it really is very hard to beat what NZXT has managed in this gorgeous case. It runs SILENT keeping the noise in, with tempered glass its hard to go wrong. I gave -1 star because the material quality is not as good as you'd think. It could use better thumb screws. Over all though, sexy, slim, smaller than your average midtower, and absolutely gorgeous.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Solid
customer_reviews.text: Its a pretty nice tower case, cant say anything went wrong other then the box was very beat up when it arrive but it works and everything is functional once I put all of the parts in. People may be thrown off by the already attached/included cables, the usb3 connector has some issues with fitting but since I used my mother boards usb ports for mouse and keypad works very well. Quite pretty and smooth and quiet. Nice keep.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love the case, sleek and minimal, cable management is amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Pros: -Easy to build with -Sleek, minimal design -Cable management integrated well Cons: -SSD harnesses are out in the open, which interrupts the minimalist approach a bit Detailed Review: Built my first PC using this case, as it has a very sleek, minimalist look to it. It was very easy to install all the components and the integrated cable management made it very easy to maintain the minimal theme throughout. As mentioned, the SSD harnesses are in the open, rather than hidden by the lip on the inside like the HDDs, but otherwise the case is amazing. Would recommend to all!
customer_reviews.author: Rasul S.

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE THIS CASE
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to clean dust filter in the front, much easier on this model than on the "Newest " version that requires entire side cover to be removed to clean tiny front filter. Great case, very durable! Only thing to be wary of if you buy glossy.....fingerprints will show. Great value for the price. I'm in the IT/Electronics industry and I will ALWAYS buy NZXT cases, have for years.
customer_reviews.author: bob plapp

customer_reviews.title: Great case if looks aren't everything
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice case. It really isn't anything special, but it's spacious, looks sleek and has very good cable management features. I ended up switching from this case to the Corsair Crystal case, because this one just starts to look very boring after having it sit on my desk for a year. Regardless, air flow is good and the fans it comes with are good as well. The magnetic dust traps are great to have, and since it sits up off the ground a little bit there's great airflow from 4 sides.
customer_reviews.author: Iowa Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Seems they have updated the design.
customer_reviews.text: Blown away by the quality. They have updated the design and now there is a higher quality battery air filter and the back panel next to the pci slots have been closed off with another piece of metal. I honestly wouldn't consider this a budget case, the value is astronomical. Packaging was also very good IMO. Styrofoam capped the two sides preventing the case from touching the side of the cardboard. As the reviews have stated cable management is very easy and little effort can make it look like a professional job.
customer_reviews.author: Boots

customer_reviews.title: Case design has come a long way.
customer_reviews.text: Kudos to NZXT for their brilliant S340VR elite! It made assembling a clean looking scratch build easy. Pros: + Cutouts-a-plenty! No need to dremel new cutouts (unlike the old nine hundred). + Deep non-windowed “dirty side” for thick braided wire access and routing. Mutant strength to replace the cover not required! + Dust covers on both intakes. + Beautiful tempered glass window
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Hur

customer_reviews.title: Looks Great, Quality for the Price
customer_reviews.text: Bought this case for my boyfriend when he was re-building his gaming computer. He was going to use his old dirty ugly case, but since I have to look at it on his desk next to mine I went ahead and got this anyways. It looks sleek and simple, and with the rgb strip I put in the top it really shows off his hardware. The quality is good for the price, just be careful not to scratch the plastic window or it won't look good over time.
customer_reviews.author: Casey Cole

customer_reviews.title: Best Standard Case
customer_reviews.text: This case makes my low budget build look like it's twice the make! There is plenty of room for cable management, and air flow is great too. The dust filter on the bottom works well and is easy to access+clean. The rubber on the bottom pegs helps with keeping the vibrations as quiet as it can. The stock fans are great and not too noisy as long as you set them to around 700RPM. It is the best mid tier case out there in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: An excellent case, plenty of room and good cable management ...
customer_reviews.text: An excellent case, plenty of room and good cable management to prevent cooling blockage. Marked down one star because some of the screw taps did not seem to be cut very well. The side panel screws were very difficult to remove, almost like they weren't inserted well and after getting them out, didn't always fit correctly. The front panel has plastic tabs that insert into holes in the case to hold it on. Even after using the instructions to remove the panel, one of the plastic tabs broke but not a show stopper. Well built and solid.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... to upgrade my 2011 case finally and couldn't be happier. The case is
customer_reviews.text: I figured it was time to upgrade my 2011 case finally and couldn't be happier. The case is, as you expect, designed for clean cable management. Everything was simple to put together and came out amazing! I've never been a fan of a window on your case, honestly I like simple, but I wanted something to bring my HDMI ports to the front for easy VR access and was not disappointed. If you're looking for a high quality case that is functional without being gaudy... but also TRULY takes a clean case design to heart this is the BEST option!
customer_reviews.author: David Kuznicki

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected!
customer_reviews.text: Really awesome case, perfect size, great cable management with none of those ugly rubber grommets seen on other cases, instead NZXT opted for a port that the cables just fit right through. AMAZING construction quality compared to alot of other cases out there, no wobbly panels and feels super durable. The glass panel is a great touch. Pre-installed fans runs quiet and have nice airflow. Removable SSD mounts make swapping drives a breeze. Front panel pops right off to clean and swap fans. Looks way better in person than the pictures!
customer_reviews.author: senorencurtido

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful but well-built, too
customer_reviews.text: Replaced a bulky black case that looked a little too teenager. This one was just right. Clean, simple lines. Beautiful enameled aluminum paneling. Handy window that lets me see the little debug readout from my motherboard and otherwise watch what's going on. It looks very nice in my living room, next to my workspace. Installation in the case was super easy. The captive thumbscrews on the side panel are appreciated—getting in and out of there is made really easy. Between my aftermarket CPU cooler and the case's built-in fans, all components are at safe temperatures even under heavy load. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Danilo Campos

customer_reviews.title: Looks incredible!
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install everything i had. Plenty of room for moderate add ons. The quality is always superb. Looks amazing. If i had anything negative to say about this is just the feel of the case in general. Sometimes it can feel a bit plasticy/cheap. I cant really explain what i mean really but thats just my opinion. Overall thoguh, this is one of the best case for its price!
customer_reviews.author: Peter Thor

customer_reviews.title: awesome! had to update my case to fit in ...
customer_reviews.text: awesome! had to update my case to fit in a GTX 1070. Was a bit tight getting the motherboard in around the cable guide plate, but not too bad. That said this is only my second build, first in a few years, so maybe this is normal. Once the mobo was in tho everything else took care of itself. Awesome cables. Only other warning would be to those with older power supplies like mine (non-modular), i have a lot of extra cables stuffed into the bottom of my case right now....
customer_reviews.author: Tim S.

customer_reviews.title: I love building in this case cable management is easy and ...
customer_reviews.text: I love building in this case cable management is easy and everything just fits. My only gripe is that the airflow in this case isn't the best if you are thinking of front mounting a rad. Had to run my fans a 90% on my EVGA 1080ti FTW3 elite gaming card. After i installed the Hybrid cooler onto the GPU the temps where easily controlled with very low fan speeds.
customer_reviews.author: ethan

customer_reviews.title: missin parts
customer_reviews.text: after opening the tower i was very pleased to see it in outstanding condition but upon opening the tower itself i noticed that it was missing the 2 clips on the back set for the wires to be held in place and out of the way its not to big of a deal considering i can just use zip ties in place but it does kinda suck to expect something to be in new condition and then open it just to find out that its missing parts
customer_reviews.author: skylar dion

customer_reviews.title: Great case, but I took off one star because ...
customer_reviews.text: Great case, but I took off one star because it is such a hassle trying to install a new HDD into the case. You have to take out the power supply, unscrew the front, detach some cables, and then put it all back together. I don’t know why it has to be a 4 step process to put in an extra HDD. I’m not going to take off a star for this but I do wish the routing holes were just slightly bigger by maybe an inch or two I can barely fit some cables through.
customer_reviews.author: Nova

customer_reviews.title: Glass is perfectly clear!
customer_reviews.text: One of the corners had a dent/chip in it. Great case, looks amazing! Make sure you get your cables plugged into your PSU beforehand, it's a tight area to work with. (GPU on the way, pictured without)
customer_reviews.author: Topher Gehlke

customer_reviews.title: Very Impressed
customer_reviews.text: Just finished an Intel I9-7900X build in this case and was extremely impressed with the NZXT S340 Elite. The built in cable management and routing options for wiring was great. Every time I needed an extra pass through there always seemed to be a hole in the right place. The look of the case is very classy with the all black scheme that I chose. I would definitely recommend this case for a first time builder.
customer_reviews.author: HOWARD W FULP JR

customer_reviews.title: Sleek and rad case, shiny black is a finger print magnet
customer_reviews.text: This is a great case. The design is sleek and has adequate room for cable management. However, the black scheme is a shiny black finish (aka finger print magnet). Just be careful of the amount of cables you use. If you want to use custom sleeves, make sure they are actual pay cables and not extensions. My case got a bit too crowded with the original PSU and extension sleeves. Also with a total of 4 drives and rgb fan wires, you have to play Tetris with the cable management.
customer_reviews.author: Min

customer_reviews.title: A Perfect Case
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a complete beginner to building PC's. This case is the perfect size for a desk, and everything feels sturdy and nice. It doesn't feel cheap and has a good heft of weight to it. The cable management in the back is absolutely perfect and had so many tie downs to zip tie my cables to. The case itself is sleek and gorgeous. I sat down looking at cases for several weeks and kept coming back to this one, and I have not been disappointed in the slightest.
customer_reviews.author: Jax

customer_reviews.title: Take your time with the glass, you may end up accidentally scratching it if you mishandle it.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing case, easy to build in with plenty of room. Cons: - Glass panel obviously scratches easily, so be careful. - Fitting in your power supply first will result in difficulty of installing any HDDs. - Front doesn't support push/pull because of clearance issues. Pros: - Easy to work with. - Simple cable management. - Clean aesthetic. - Great and easy to remove dust filters.
customer_reviews.author: Rondel Nabua

customer_reviews.title: Slick, Priced Well, and Tons of Space
customer_reviews.text: A lot of space and comes with two fans (wish I knew beforehand) pre-installed. The power supply was the only difficult part since this was my first build and I had a bit of trouble with the wiring since there is only a few places the wires are able to go through. However, think more to blame the power supply than the case. The glass is a great addition and allows you to see your masterpiece with ease. Great price as well.
customer_reviews.author: William Selinger

customer_reviews.title: Great multi-functional case for gaming, media, or daily computing.
customer_reviews.text: This case offers a lot of cool features. - multi-fan placement support - cable management - easy to access side panel - multiple 2.5" and 3.5" inch HDD / SDD bays - multiple magnetic dust filter screens on front and bottom. I did not have any issues installing PC parts and accessories in this case. I really enjoy all the features it comes with and I have had no problems with it yet.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Valencia

customer_reviews.title: Slick with a few compromises
customer_reviews.text: Very slick and will give 1st time builders a very easy time. Cable cut outs and cable management is as easy as it gets, its basic yet very well placed. The entire case is a good beginners case as well as for veteran builders. The only down side i see here is airflow, yes there is airflow but it will only be limited. Used to have the NZXT Phanom 410 before it started to discolor and updated my with S340 Elite. All in all, happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Rhapsody

customer_reviews.title: Best case I have ever used
customer_reviews.text: Best case I have ever used! Hands down the best bang for the buck. Incredible wire management capabilities and existing mounts to upgrade to water cooling in the future. Almost a dead silent case with factory 120mm fans and the window is perfect. I went with the MSI Krait MOBO to match and all I need now is some wicked blacklight lighting. Oh, rubber feet on the bottom is perfect for anti-vibration and dust filters are magnetic. This is the minimalist case with just enough flash to remain relevant to custom PC builds. I will use this case until it falls apart!
customer_reviews.author: Barry Leigh Vest Sr.

customer_reviews.title: NZXT S340 Mid Tower is a quality case
customer_reviews.text: At a budget price, this case serves my needs in a great way. Enough room to work in (even with my large hands), great placement for SSDs and hides larger HDDs, love the PSU shroud. The biggest plus for this case? Cable Management is a breeze, and everything is kept out of view from the front. The only issue I have with this case (which is a well known issue by now) is how easily the window can get scratched (I believe that NZXT will work with people to get that repleced). In spite of that, it's a case that I would highly recommend for anyone looking for a mid tower with plenty of room and decent airflow.
customer_reviews.author: Omar-Fara Norgaisse

customer_reviews.title: Great airflow and cable management!
customer_reviews.text: Simply put I love this case! I was hesitant to purchase because someone mentioned that it had poor airflow, but they are simply mistaken! Now I don’t OC or anything so I could be wrong, but I went from my old case with my 1070 running 74-75c ish at the pubg lobby (for benchmark purposes of course) Now in the case with the same fans in the same places (2 out 1 in) the temps stay around 71-72 not a huge improvement but enough to show that airflow is not a worry for this case
customer_reviews.author: cerebralhunt

customer_reviews.title: All around a perfect case.
customer_reviews.text: Overall fantastic case. Had no issues installing everything. Best feature of the way they allow you to hide all the cables in the back to make a clean look. The reason for the 4 star. Is because the case cover screws when taking them out seem to be a little stripped. They must have been machines wrong. I added just a tiny bit of machine threading oil to the screw threads and it helped. In the end I would buy this again. Perfect and clean looking. 👍
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Easy and good looking
customer_reviews.text: Easy to build in, speaking as a first time builder. Also exceptionally good looking. Only downside is the subpar airflow. It has space for two 140 mm fans upfront, but only gives them two small slits for them to suck air from located on the top and bottom of the front panel. Front panel comes off with a tug that almost felt like it'd break something the first time, but don'd stress it, it's just the snug fit.
customer_reviews.author: Jesus F. Serrano

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful and functional
customer_reviews.text: Definitely worth the couple extra bucks. I have gotten multiple compliments on this case. The tempered glass is my favorite part of the whole thing as it is scratch resistant and easy to clean. Multiple people have asked me how I have such good cable management because none are visible from the outside. Lots of room to cram cables behind the motherboard.
customer_reviews.author: Logan

customer_reviews.title: Sleek sharp looking case (pay attention to the fans though).
customer_reviews.text: This case is great, lots of room, wire management in the case, and two decent fans on the top and back. If you like a sleek minimalist looking design like I do, you'll like this case a lot. Just beware a bit though, you have to pay attention to where you need to plug in the fans, because they come with wires in the case. Just make sure to plug them up, and they should work great.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Solid Case Under $70
customer_reviews.text: Removed 1 star due to some light blemishes on the inside and outside of the case. Can probably use some matte black touch up paint to fix. Also there was a light layer of dust on the inside of the case. Not a deal breaker, but wasn't 5 star worthy. Still a great case! Plan to purchase another for my wife. Asus 970 Pro Gaming.Aura Mobo 16GB G.Skill Sniper Gaming Series DDR3 FX 8350 w/ Wraith Cooler Gigabyte Windforce OC GTX 1060 6GB EVGA 750 Full Modular PSU PNY 120GB SSD Samsung 850 Evo 500GB SSD 2x WD 2TB 7200RPM HDD
customer_reviews.author: Bryon Fink

customer_reviews.title: Amazing case
customer_reviews.text: The S340 Elite is one of my favorite pc cases. It is beautiful, yet functional, while still remaining affordable. Cable management is very intuitive with the clips in the back and the basement to store your power supply and extra cables. Airflow is great... I had no issue fitting a dual 240mm rad and a 1080 inside. There is also ample space for 3.5 inch drives in the basement as well as ssd mounts up front and in the back. Build quality is great. Comes with a NZXT puck which I have no use for.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Amazing case, even better cable management!
customer_reviews.text: Finally pulled the trigger and bought it. Took a little while but I swapped everything over my old, horrible case. The case is sturdy, really well organized and has amazing cable management. There is just enough room at the top to add an LED light to it to really show off your internals. After about a month of research I finally settled S340 and I couldn't have bought a better case for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Nolte

customer_reviews.title: Excellent case. This thing was designed with airflow in ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent case. This thing was designed with airflow in mind. the space left for cable management is great and the design is very thoughtful. Overall this is a great case but it will scratch easily if you are not careful. PROS: -Great space and arrangement -Modular design -Great colors and quality plastic -Quality buttons & material CONS: -Matt finish scratched easily (BE CAREFUL) -No lock or clear way to seperate fron panel
customer_reviews.author: Justin parker

customer_reviews.title: Reading this review is not as helpful as watching a youtube video but you will anyway!
customer_reviews.text: The YouTube reviews praising this case with in depth reviews are endless. I doubt any one will find themselves reading this review. It's likely any time I spend writing this is wasted but none the less its worth mentioning if you can get this case then get this darn case. NZXT makes great stuff that looks high end at mid range budget and this case is no exception. Just grab it!
customer_reviews.author: Justin Time

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: Great case! It's open, sleek, and looks great! It was a joy to build in, and the cable management just adds to the smooth appearance. My only complaint is that you have to remove so many screws to get into the case and they're a little finicky. But honestly, if you're building all at once and don't plan to upgrade or change much after that, you won't even notice. It's open with plenty of air flow, and even with overclock, I don't see any temperature spikes or hot spots.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey Kiser

customer_reviews.title: Cool case
customer_reviews.text: I really like this case ,but I don't like that fact that the glass is arcylic. I wish it was tempered glass. Also, I frequently update and change my system and removing the screws for the front and back a couple of times it daungting. I wish there was a place to hang the headphone jack like in the new case.Also, the newer version of this has hdd bays that slide in and out.
customer_reviews.author: Aiden

customer_reviews.title: This thing is perfect. The design is cool enough to be noticeable
customer_reviews.text: This thing is perfect. The design is cool enough to be noticeable, but minimal enough to draw your attention to the hardware inside. I put a red LED strip inside mind to make it look extra cool. A word of warning: this thing will take you a LONG time to set up. It took me like 3 or 4 hours. This is because the wires have to be awkwardly led around and underneath the various surfaces. And the area for the power supply is very cramped. This is a necessary evil though, since the result is a motherboard that looks very clean and well-presented.
customer_reviews.author: FunkyVerb

customer_reviews.title: Exceeds Expectations
customer_reviews.text: This case was phenomenal. It allowed for the easiest cable management I've ever seen. I almost flipped a table when I thought it came with no screws. Remove both panels and dig in all the nooks and crannies, the goods can be quite hidden (like your cables will be). I did not expect this level of quality, I was extremely impressed. One thing to note: This case has no slots for a front facing CD/DVD/Blu Ray drive. This was not a major issue for me, but I did order one and wasn't able to use it. Just something to keep in mind if this is a show stopper for you.
customer_reviews.author: John Gibson

customer_reviews.title: Super nice case
customer_reviews.text: I love this case. Very clean and elegant. No spot for a DVD drive, but that's only because that space is utilized to fit a couple water coolers for your processor and or gpu. 24p cable to motherboard tucks away nicely along with all the other cables to the case. There's also a compartment for the power supply so those cables stay hidden and heat from the power supply doesn't rise into the rest of the case. Very clean and efficient. It also has thumbs crews which make things easy and it matches my white monitor and keyboard. Very happy so far
customer_reviews.author: michael hill

customer_reviews.title: One of the best cases I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: This case showcases everything inside your build and it does a great job at it too. The cable management clips in the back are probably the best feature of this case. I recommend this case to anyone. The matte black makes the case look real sleek and has modern look to it. fyi, one of the fans that came with the case did not work but NZXT has great customer service and they already replaced it with no hassles. This issue did not make me want to drop any stars on this review but I thought I should mention it.
customer_reviews.author: Felipe Davila

customer_reviews.title: great case, great value
customer_reviews.text: Very well designed and built. The compact mid tower format is big enough for full size graphics cards and atx mobo's/psu's, while allowing a smaller footprint. The cable management options are adequate, and the design is very discreet, allowing for a clean build. The glass panel is great, and the air flow is sufficient for high performance builds. Overall, an excellent value for a high quality case.
customer_reviews.author: ransur0t

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic case
customer_reviews.text: Love the case, just wish the shroud was a little bit lower so that USB 3.0 installation could have been easier & more efficient. Otherwise, I've had 0 issues with the case so far, you all are really here for the glass panel though, and no you don't need RGB to see through it, it's not dark and it is of high-quality glass.
customer_reviews.author: Cory W

customer_reviews.title: I love this case.
customer_reviews.text: I love this case. It has a beautiful, large tempered glass panel, more than enough cable management space, and and a nice I/O on top. I have a 240mm radiator in front for my CPU and a 120mm radiator in the rear for my GPU in addition to a 140mm case fan on top and this case has plenty of space for it. The only thing I don't like is I have a mATX motherboard and the bottom of the case looks a little empty, but that's not the case's fault. So far I have no real complaints and would definitely recommend this case.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Zak

customer_reviews.title: best. case
customer_reviews.text: best. case. ever. i will never be buying another brand case. the way this thing is layed out makes it SO EASY to manage your cabling. SSD mounts to beautifully display your SSD's. HDD bays to hide your ugly HDD's. i love it. if you're thinking of buying this case, press buy. it's awesome. you won't be disappointed. who needs a DVD drive nowadays anyhow?
customer_reviews.author: w0Otah

customer_reviews.title: I love this case!!
customer_reviews.text: this case is amazing. such good airflow. I would recommend taking the 2 included case fans off of the connection they set up where they run full speed. they are actually really good fans, just loud at full speed and that is how they set them up from the jump. I love love love this case. I really do.
customer_reviews.author: Happy in Tampa

customer_reviews.title: each time even better, may be annoying but it is still an ...
customer_reviews.text: I have bought a total of 3 of these cases and i noticed they are still improving on this model even, little differences here and there.... each time even better, may be annoying but it is still an improvement like the extra back plate that protects the slits, didnt use to be there. point is this is a solid product i love it, it looks great it works great it runs great, thank you.
customer_reviews.author: garebear29

customer_reviews.title: Excellent case with all the amenities you would expect from ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent case with all the amenities you would expect from a modern case. Cable management is easy, especially with the full length power supply shroud. I'm glad this case included spzce for multiple exhaust fans, this allows me to run the system in a truly nuetral pressure configuration. Only downside is the lack of USB 3.1 Type C port, hopefully they include this with the next version.
customer_reviews.author: M.C. Fresher

customer_reviews.title: beautiful case, great wire managment(my first build and i ...
customer_reviews.text: Where to start,fast shipping,beautiful case,great wire managment(my first build and i think it turned out good),at the expense of optical bays you gain a massive amount of room to upgrade/add extras there is a nice bay at the bottom that houses the psu and keeps it exremely cool and it houses the hard drive as well(2 Slots)on top of that is there is 2 slots for ssds as well.room for 4 fans and it keeps everything running cool it also came with all the screws to attach motherboard and hard drives,came with dust filters so far it seems to keep dust out very well.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Metzer

customer_reviews.title: A fantastic tower!!
customer_reviews.text: Simply beautiful, classy looking, and so versatile. I love the extra USB connections at the front of the tower. This was a gift for my son's 16th birthday, along with the rest of the parts to build a fabulous gaming computer at 1/2 the pre-assembled price. He's even ready to enjoy VR for the next several to many years. I haven't seen any other tower yet that I like as much as this one, and after having used it I can't imagine any other is as conveniently designed.
customer_reviews.author: JuJuBee

customer_reviews.title: Great case
customer_reviews.text: (NZXT S340 case review) A very well thought together case that looks amazing. Pros: Looks nice Thought out pretty well Middle: Minimalist design Cons: I/O shield was significantly hard to insert than my previous case. Very glossy window, makes it sort of difficult to see through the window. Other information: I got it for $66 dollars when it was on sale from $150, so that is pretty nice. The I/O shield was difficult to install, so I recommend using your screwdrivers handle to press it in.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Hicks

customer_reviews.title: Great bargain
customer_reviews.text: Keeps the dust to a reasonable minimum. Just cleaned it for the first time in 4 months, and it was nowhere near as disgusting as I was anticipating. Plus, the case is pretty well-designed in terms of keeping cable clustering to a minimum. Finally, the aesthetic is very crispy. I'm extremely pleased with it, especially given that it was one of the cheaper options available to me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this case and makes for a sweet build IMO
customer_reviews.text: There is a reason this case has a cult following. LOVE the practicality of this case. Builds to a super clean look. Has everything you want. There is a reason that this case is out of stock so much. The window does scratch easily so be careful. I replaced the stock fans with Noctua ones because they are quieter.
customer_reviews.author: sailorcolin

customer_reviews.title: First build friendly
customer_reviews.text: The S340 was the case I chose for my first build because based on reviews it's super simple to build in. I have to say that the reviews are definitely right in that's it's very beginner friendly for a first build. Plenty of room to work in and cable management is super simple thanks to the room in the PSU shroud and the management bar. As a heads up I will say to install your HDD before your power supply so you can reach the interior screw for HDD with less hassle. Other than that I'm very happy with my choice of case.
customer_reviews.author: Josh M.

customer_reviews.title: Like the case
customer_reviews.text: Like the case. Looks good and I've grown to like the glass. I think it might be on the more expensive side nowadays, but it was a good deal in 2017 if you were willing to splurge on tempered glass. My only issue is one of the rubber feet came off. I contacted NZXT to see if I could buy another but got no response.
customer_reviews.author: Chet Manly

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Gift
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift for my fiancés birthday and he loves it. He loves how simple and sleek it looks, I was a little weary because he was downsizing from a full-size case because he wanted something that would fit the components better. I thought it may be too small for what he is going for but I was wrong. It was delievered on time and the packaging was just right and protected the case and there were no dings or scratches anywhere on the case itself.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Gambino

customer_reviews.title: White, minimalist, sturdy, lovely.
customer_reviews.text: I love this case. It's the sweet spot for build and price. The steel feels really durable, and the usability is fantastic. My build is coming along very well and the bar/shroud inside provides a nice way to hide a lot of cables. It makes it look very clean inside (something every case with a window should be). Speaking of the window, it is not glass, so be very careful with it when building. It can take a scratch pretty easily. I'd recommend this for the budget minded, along with anyone with a knack for slapping art/designs on their cases (like mine).
customer_reviews.author: S. Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect small form case!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic Quality, and plenty of potential for custom water cooling projects. NZXT never disappoints, and as long as you're alright with having no DVD/ BLU-RAY drives or the like internally mounted (You can/should get a USB external one to hook up as needed), you'll be quite satisfied. Only one Con I wish the SSD plates were a little more of an option than they are in this case. If you're like me and only use one SSD, then the other plate looks ugly empty, or even removed. This may also be a problem if you want to use this lower spot for a liquid cooling build, but have to contend with unsightly additional mounting holes.
customer_reviews.author: K. Wetzel

customer_reviews.title: Great..!-But not for the Price.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic Case to build in! Though, with the Acrylic side panel, it's easy to scratch, and draws in dust easily, so I'd recommend spending a bit more cash on the 'Elite' version, as its even easier to build in, and it's of a much better quality. I feel like it should be of a better quality if it's in the 60 dollar range, and I suggest that you don't cheap out on your case if you don't have to. The extra 20 is worth it in the long run.
customer_reviews.author: HeathTurner

customer_reviews.title: Great case, perfect size
customer_reviews.text: Great case, perfect size, I was able to front mount my kraken x62 radiator, fit my Galax GTX 1080 HoF with no issues. Only one downfall i find with this case is that I feel it should have another fan mount on top of the case so it would have two instead of only one fan top mounted. Overall I am very pleased with this case. The tempered glass side is beautiful and crystal clear! Hard to even notice the side is on. Lots of different options for hiding cables and cable management. Like I said this is a great case and worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Gestner

customer_reviews.title: Looks great plus provided enough room for my build
customer_reviews.text: This case rocks! Looks great plus provided enough room for my build. Cooling concerns? Put them to rest. This thing is great with my fans and I have zero heating issues. Great value, quality, price, and it looks great too. What more can you ask for?
customer_reviews.author: Tyler W

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful and well constructed case
customer_reviews.text: This is a beautiful, sleek, roomy and well constructed case. Definitely worth the price in my opinion. The tempered glass side is super clear allowing you to show off your rad build in all its glory. Just be careful when removing and installing the glass! The SSD/HDD bays are out of the way and the power supply area is covered keeping the case nice and tidy. Some might not like the lack of an optical drive bay but if you really need it an external drive is a cheap and easy solution. If you are thinking of buying this case just do it. You will not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Cover shroud for psu not removable.
customer_reviews.text: This was a major pain trying to work with. I sized down from my corsair 600t graphite and this was annoying to plug in the power cables. You really need to make sure you plan out how you're going to plug in everything BEFORE jumping into assembling everything. The shroud is not adjustable and you can't remove it. Also the bar in the middle for cable management had awful screws that I can't unscrew now because they were worn.
customer_reviews.author: UnpracticalGaming

customer_reviews.title: NZXT S340
customer_reviews.text: This case is very nice! Although I have never built a PC before, this case was amazing and i loved it. The side panel with the window lets me see my build is a big plus. The cable management is somewhat easy with this case as well. I like how i could put my psu hidden away from everything else as well. Only thing that bugged me is the SSD slots on top of the psu cover didn't work well with my ssd to SATA cable; however, I was still able to put my SSD in the hard drive bay. The box didn't come damaged like others claimed theirs to be which was nice. I highly recommend this case!
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Perfect For Beginner Builds Who Still Want A Sexy Case
customer_reviews.text: This case was everything I expected of it considering I did alot of research on it before purchasing. If you're looking for a well priced mid sized case that's easy to build wit more than enough room to facilitate almost any pc part then this is the case for you. Just consider what you want in your pc and fan orientation before you decide on what case you will buy. As for shipping and customer service it was a very smooth transaction.Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: NZXT really ought to consider moving the location of the front usb ports. Most people feature such a beautiful case like this one on their desk. It's annoying to stand up from your chair to plug in usb devices to the top of the computer. I guess I'll purchase a usb hub. Furthermore, this is an excellent case. Overall I'm satisfied with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Woodard

customer_reviews.title: Get it
customer_reviews.text: Awesome case, super tidy. The only thing that I can say is a negative is that the oem fans are louder than I expected. They aren’t loud, just louder than my old MacPro (non-trash can). I’m using it for music production and as soon as I’m mixing, the fan noise is gone, but would have liked them to have been closer to my cpu fan dB level.
customer_reviews.author: Mittens

customer_reviews.title: Great 1st PC Case
customer_reviews.text: Love the case. Was easy for me to build in, and as a first time PC builder I was extremely anxious as to whether or not I would have enough room to fit everything. Glad to say that I had no hassle building inside this beauty. It still looks extremely nice, love the subtle red, and the bar was super helpful with cable management. If you're considering a decent case or a first time builder, I would recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: Adil Ahmad

customer_reviews.title: Great case
customer_reviews.text: This case is great. It's roomy enough but compact. I had no problems with it--and I used it on my first build. There are a few things to know. There are no drive bays, so you can't install an optical disk drive. The data drives all sit inside the case near the bottom. There are two fans that come installed in the case, and they're wired together, so you can easily install two more. The sides come off and go back on really easily, which is nice. So far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome case
customer_reviews.text: This case is awesome, for everything I needed to inside the case with no issue and cable management is a breeze. I even bought some phanteks cable extensions for asthetics and was able to hide a crap ton of excess cable into the back of the case and not a single eye sore. I recommend this to all.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: NZXT S340 Elite ATX Mid Tower Computer Case, Matte Black/Red (CA-S340W-B4)
product_meta.description: Style:S340 Elite| Color:Black/RedExpanding on the s340's renowned durability, the S340 Elite features a tempered glass panel to showcase builds with crisp clarity. The top IO panel has been optimized with an HDMI port and additional USB ports for a streamlined VR experience. It includes a magnetic cable management puck to conveniently store VR or audio headsets with fast and flexible mounting access. The S340 Elite is strong, compact, and takes the S340 chassis to new heights.
feature_bullets: Giant window all steel construction and tempered glass panel guarantee a crisp view of your system; The s340 elite is made to highlight your build so your efforts will never go unseen; Dimensions: w 20 ; h 47; 43 millimeter
Gets better with VR streamlined VR access with hdmi and USB 3.0 from the top io; Easy to use headset and vr cable management puck, or split the puck apart for longer cable coverage
Ultra clean interior an open interior with a steel cable management bar splits the front intake from the rest of the case; A new clamping system has been added for a clean and hassle free build
Detailed engineering fully filtered intakes, steel plated audio jacks, captive thumb screws, and cable management solutions that keep your build looking sleek inside a compact chassis
Embrace the kraken there is no sacrificing performance with this small midtower case that boasts full compatibility with our kraken series liquid coolers

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars2,483 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
